message.content:
cs.NI, cs.MM, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.AI. 

The paper proposes a congestion control scheme for multimedia streaming over IP networks, which involves modeling the problem using a Finite-Horizon Markov Decision Process (FHMDP) and determining the optimal congestion control policy. This suggests that the paper could belong to the Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) category. Additionally, the paper focuses on improving multimedia streaming quality by considering distortion impacts, delay deadlines, and interdependencies of different video packet classes, which suggests that it could also belong to the Multimedia (cs.MM) category. The paper also mentions deriving sufficient conditions for multiple multimedia users to achieve quality-based fairness using media-TCP congestion control, which suggests that it could belong to the Information Theory (cs.IT) category. Furthermore, the paper proposes a solution that adapts the sending rate to both the network condition and the application characteristics, which suggests that it could belong to the Systems and Control (cs.SY) category. Finally, the paper uses a Markov Decision Process to determine the optimal congestion control policy, which suggests that it could also belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) category.
